mark_message_for_destruction(message)

Performs a "soft" delete of a message then check if it can do a destroy on the message

  • Marks Inbox messages as "receiver deleted" essentially moving the message to the Trash Bin
  • Marks Outbox messages as "sender_deleted" and "purged" removing the message from [:inbox_messages, :outbox_messages, :trashbin_messages]
  • Marks Trash Bin messages as "receiver purged"
  • Checks to see if both the sender and reciever have purged the message. If so, the message record is destroyed

Returns to the updated view of the current "mailbox"

[Source]

     # File ../../../app/controllers/messages_controller.rb, line 162
162:   def mark_message_for_destruction(message)
163:     if can_view(message)
164:       
165:       # "inbox"
166:       if rezm_user.id == message.receiver_id and !message.receiver_deleted
167:         message.receiver_deleted = true             
168:             
169:       # "outbox"
170:       elsif rezm_user.id == message.sender_id
171:         message.sender_deleted = true
172:         message.sender_purged = true
173:             
174:       # "trash_bin"
175:       elsif rezm_user.id == message.receiver_id and message.receiver_deleted
176:         message.receiver_purged = true
177:       end
178:       
179:       message.save(false) 
180:       message.purge
181:     end
182:   end
